intro: Hieracium absconditum, commonly known as the hidden hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium absconditum is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas, preferring well-drained soils.
